projects.name: macOS Intelligence MCP Framework
projects.description: Comprehensive macOS automation framework with 5 MCP servers: screen intelligence with native OCR, system control via AppleScript/RobotJS, power management with battery optimization, usage analytics with local SQLite, and Apple Shortcuts automation with natural language creation. Privacy-first with local data storage and Claude Desktop integration.

projects.name: Reel2Trip (ixigo Hackweek '25)
projects.description: AI-powered travel itinerary generator that transforms Instagram Reels and YouTube Shorts into personalized travel plans. Features Instagram DM integration, smart destination identification, day-wise activity planning, flight recommendations, and chat-based customization with MILO bot. Built with Gemini/GPT-4 AI, reducing manual planning effort by 70% while seamlessly integrating into ixigo's flight booking ecosystem.

projects.name: Auth MCP OAuth Framework
projects.description: OAuth 2.0 for MCP with PKCE, AES-256, auto-refresh, multi-provider; TS SDK

projects.name: WebRTC Voice AI - Real-time Conversational Agent
projects.description: Built a real-time voice AI proof-of-concept using WebRTC for low-latency audio streaming. Integrated Deepgram for live Hindi transcription, OpenAI GPT-3.5 for conversational responses, and AWS Polly for neural voice synthesis. Implemented MediaSoup for optimized WebRTC transport with performance monitoring and latency tracking across the entire pipeline.

projects.name: ISRO X-Ray Burst Automation
projects.description: React system to identify solar bursts; data segregation; Silver medal at Inter IIT

projects.name: Machine Learning Project - CS771
projects.description: Developed linear models (Linear SVC, Logistic Regression) to crack XORRO PUF with 99% accuracy. Implemented Decision Trees for Hangman-Wordle hybrid achieving 100% accuracy with 3.99 avg query rate. Built ML models for air quality sensor calibration using Elastic Net and Extra Tree Regressor, achieving MAE of 1.67 for O3 and 1.01 for NO2.

projects.name: Conway's Game of Life - Stanford CS106a
projects.description: Completed Stanford's foundational programming course and developed Python simulation of Conway's Game of Life using pygame and numpy. Created dynamic population growth models with cellular automaton, state transitions, and neighborhood configurations. Enhanced algorithmic problem-solving skills and gained proficiency in image processing and GUI development.

projects.name: Techkriti'23 - Head Web & App
projects.description: Revamped the entire tech architecture for IIT Kanpur's flagship fest while leading a 3-tier development team. Optimized the large MERN codebase through Webpack compression and performance enhancements. Successfully handled 350K+ monthly visits and 30K+ daily traffic, maintained 15K+ active users, and drove 30% YoY growth across 10+ corporate partnerships.
